document.docAuthor: Gonçalves, Ricardo Antonio & Brescovit, Antonio Domingos
document.docTitle: Epicratinus perfidus Gonçalves & Brescovit 2020, new combination
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review and cladistic analysis of Neotropical spider genus Epicratinus Jocqué & Baert, 2005 (Araneae: Zodariidae) with description of eleven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review and cladistic analysis of Neotropical spider genus Epicratinus Jocqué & Baert, 2005 (Araneae: Zodariidae) with description of eleven new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Tenedos perfidus
Jocqué & Baert, 2002: 112
, fig. 30 a–d (male holotype from Santo Antonio de Leverger , 15º52’25.9”S , 56º04’39.3”W , Mato Grosso , BRAZIL , 1♁,
13/X/1981
, H. Duarte , deposited in MCTP 2546, examined. Paratypes : 1♁ 1♀ , same locality and collector,
03/II/1982
, deposited in MCTP 2545 , examined).

Epicratinus santacruz
Grismado & Izquierdo, 2016: 76
, f. 1A–G, 2A–D, 3A–E, 4A–F, 5A–D ( Male holotype from Concesión Forestal La Chonta , 15º42’42”S , 62º46’20”W , Santa Cruz Department : Guarayos Province : Bolivia ,
elevation 330 m
,
26–30 October 2010
, Amazon rainforest with selective fall, pitfall traps , C. Grismado , M. R. Vacaflores and M. Pérez (CBF). Paratypes : same data of holotype : 5♁, 1♀ (MACN-Ar 28927), 3♁ (MACN-Ar 29133), 1♁ (MLP), 1♁ (LBRE); 1♀ (MACN-Ar 28925), 1♀ (MACN-Ar 28928); litter, 1♁, 4♀ (MACN-Ar 28926), 1♀ (LBRE), not examined).
New Synonym
.

subSubSection.paragraph:

.

Diagnosis. Males of
E. perfidus
comb. nov.
are recognized by the male palp tibia for having a dorsal projection with a bifid apex, with two flattened tips, which fit into the cymbium concavity. Females possess the epigynum with large and protruding plaque with curved sides, much narrower in front than in the back ( Figs 8 , 9 ).

Transference and synonymy: Detailed study of the
Tenedos perfidus
type material collected in Mato Grosso (MCP 2545 and 2546) showed that specimen has the diagnostic characteristics of the genus: posterior eye row strongly procurve, medium and lateral posterior spinnerets fused in the females and the total absence of these spinnerets in the males, exhibiting the typical morphology of
Epicratinus
. Examining the description of
E. santacruz
(see Grismado & Izquierdo, 2016 ) and the available material type of
Epicratinus perfidus
, showed that these species have the same diagnostic characteristics and are herein considered synonyms.

Description. See Jocqué & Baert, 2002: 112 and Grismado & Izquierdo, 2016 . Supplementary information: Male (MCTP 2546). Clypeus height: 0.76. Eyes: diameters AME 0.08, ALE 0.12, PME 0.1, PLE 0.12; Interdistances AME-AME 0.06, AME-ALE 0.12, PME-PME 0.12, PME-PLE 0.32, ALE-PLE 0.06.
Female (MCTP 2545). Clypeus height: 0.96. Eyes: diameters AME 0.14, ALE 0.12, PME 0.18, PLE 0.14; Interdistances AME-AME 0.06, AME-ALE 0.14, PME-PME 0.12, PME-PLE 0.42, ALE-PLE 0.08.
Variation. Males (n = 10): total length 5.7‾5.99, carapace 2.84‾3.0, femur I 1.6‾1.82. Females (n = 10): total length 7‾8.8, carapace 3.4‾3.6, femur I 1.60‾1.72.
Distribution. Bolivia ( Santa Cruz ) and central west northeast and southeast regions of Brazil ( Fig. 40 ).
